contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to have someone circumcise him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God trusted me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God issued the law with the help of angels, and a mediator put it into force" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The law was put into force through angels by a mediator

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form, and the abstract noun "life" can be translated with the verb "live." AT: "if God had given a law that enabled those who kept it to live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: if a law had been given that could give life

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the law held us captive and we were in prison" or "the law held us captive in prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: we were held captive under the law, imprisoned

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form, and who this faith is in can be stated clearly. AT: "until God would reveal that he justifies those who have faith in Christ" or "until God would reveal that he justifies those who trust in Christ" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

Before Christ came, God had planned to justify us. When Christ came, he carried out his plan to justify us. This can be stated in active form. AT: "so that God would declare us to be righteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so that we might be justified

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God knows you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

This can be stated in active form. AT: "the teaching about the cross has no stumbling block" or "there is nothing in the teaching of the cross that would cause people to stumble" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the stumbling block of the cross has been removed

contextId.information: This can be expressed in an active form. AT: "God has called you to freedom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "I think of the world as already dead" or "I treat the world like a criminal God has killed on a cross" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the world has been crucified to me
